goal.en: This course aims to introduce critical approaches to the study of modernity in relation to colonial histories. Its goal is to equip students with critical knowledges and analytical skills: 1) to examine how (Anglo-European) modernity is represented as a universalized teleology of historical progress for all humanity; 2) to develop decolonial perspectives of reconsidering our historical relationship to the colonial formations of modernity in the mediated everyday life by our social practices, political ideas, economic life, and cultural expressions. This introductory course gives students an understanding of the historical conditions out of which the English department has developed in non-Anglophone societies and is designed to prepare students with essential knowledge and skills for critical Anglophone studies in the department.
goal.ch: 本課程專門為鋪墊學生對英國文學、殖民主義、帝國主義、歐洲現代性輸出及後殖民文化構成的基本認知而設，並對思考文學敘事再現與文化政治的關係，將有助益。

content.en: Over the course of the semester, students will read selected literary, historical and cultural texts on colonialism from different historical periods and social perspectives. Students will be asked to study literary texts in relation to discursive texts. Students must complete assigned readings before class, be prepared to discuss the readings in class, raise and answer questions regarding each others’ presentations and projects.
content.ch: 我們將以當代目光重新審視英語文學中對於帝國及殖民的思考，及殖民論述如何重塑全球族群、性/別與階級關係，亦會考量文學及電影呈現的文明價值、慾望，與道德倫理中的現代性。

grading.en: Those who attend the first week, take the first quiz, and who have read the novel Robinson Crusoe Chs. 1-4 and 8-9 will be given priority to enroll. In-class discussion and presentation, training in independent research abilities and time management skills are essential components of this course. https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/521 First quiz 15％ (based on Crusoe Chs. 1-4 and 8-9); Class participation and discussion 20％; Group research projects 25％; Class presentations 20％; Final debate 20％
grading.ch: 第一週出席的學生及已讀過Robinson Crusoe 第1-4章及8-9章將被優先錄取。https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/521 第一週小考 (必須通過) 15％ (Crusoe 第1-4章及8-9章); 課上參與及討論 20％; 小組研習 25％; 課上報告 20％; 辯論20％

flex_desc.en: This seminar is designed as a student-tailored, project-based learning process. Students use the last two weeks to finish their final research projects and learn from group discussions.
flex_desc.ch: 以小組討論、研究提案、學生辯論及報告作為學習方法。同學運用最後兩週總結學習心得，及完成研究報告。
